intro: Arabis rupestris, commonly known as rock白菜, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Arabis rupestris is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens.
